messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All !!!! I am brand new here. In fact, this is the first thread that I have read. I usually lurk for a while after joining a new list but I have to say
messages.messageBody:
Hi All !!!!

I am brand new here. In fact, this is the first thread that I have read. I
usually lurk for a while after joining a new list but I have to say right away
...........WOW !!!!

Thought I would come into some unschooling topics but sexy men works for me
too !!!!! :-)

I agree with many of the previously mentioned group.I have to add Brad Pitt
who always looks too yummy for words. And last night I watched " A Time to Kill
" - Matthew McConahey (sp?) - double yummy !!!!

Glad to be part of such a fun group !!!!

Keli


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: ... though he smells but couldn t possibly  I think Kevin Klein is a terrific actor. I couldn t EVEN believe it, when I found out it was HIM in French Kiss.
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Lee-Ann and Robert
Storer" <lrjem1@d...> wrote:
> Kevin Kline - in any movie even French Kiss where he looks as
though he smells but couldn't possibly <g>

I think Kevin Klein is a terrific actor. I couldn't EVEN believe it,
when I found out it was HIM in French Kiss. *slurp*


>
> Sean Connery - just keeps getting sexier -

did you see him in Time Bandits? Oh, BABY. It was when he was
younger. mmmmm. He plays King Ageas, in a lovely little thigh length
tunic! Hoo! *my thundering pulses*

>
> Keanu Reeves - totally yum but not sexy like Sean Connery - just
yum.

gotta agree with you, there. Keanu is pretty slurp-able. A good
friend of mine, when her marriage was breaking up, got hooked on
Keanu. At one point, when we were out on the town, sitting in the
parking lot at Blockbuster, looking at the poster for Matrix and
drooling! L


> Once upon a time it was Harrison Ford (loved all the cat and mouse
scenes with him and carrie fisher in starwars *sigh*), but now he's
not aging too well and seems to be having a difficult time finding
an 'older' look that isn't ick.
>
> Lee-Ann in Harrow, Victoria, Australia, The World


has anyone mentioned Mel Gibson? I'm on the verge of going through a
Mel Gibson movie-thon, starting with Mad Max. Truly, I am. mmmmm. His
eyes!

HeidiC
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: ... Matthau and Danny Devito, but he s sexy to me.  ;o) How sweet. :o) My husband was once mistaken for Jason Alexander (the guy who played George Costanza
messages.messageBody:
>> BTW, I love my husband...he looks like a cross between Walter
Matthau and Danny Devito, but he's sexy to me. ;o)>>

How sweet. :o) My husband was once mistaken for Jason Alexander (the
guy who played George Costanza on Seinfeld.) He was walking down the
street during the Sundance Film Festival and somebody across the
street starting yelling "Hey George!"

Lucky for me his personality is nothng like George's. <g>

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: May I add Brendan Fraser(sp?) George of the jungle is almost a useless movie..almost. and Jackie Chan not the most beautiful man but sexy, funny, and (I would
messages.messageBody:
May I add Brendan Fraser(sp?) George of the jungle is almost a useless movie..almost.

and Jackie Chan not the most beautiful man but sexy, funny, and (I would guess) a very energetic partner.

and Patrick Swaisy(sp?) Dirty dancing, Point break.

Teresa in Canada
----- Original Message -----
From: moonstarshooter
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 02, 2003 5:32 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: being doable


> Johnny Depp is awesome...did you
> see him in "Chocolat"? A VERY cool somewhat unschooly movie. :o)

He just had way too little a role in that movie! The only one I have
seen him in yet that I just couldn't get into him in is Blow. He was
okay during one of the decades, but near the end of the movie, oh how
yuck was that!

My other doables are John Cusack and Nicolas Cage. (I love actors
who do wacked-out roles.)

Tory, who is married to one of the most normal guys around

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: Kevin Kline - in any movie even French Kiss where he looks as though he smells but couldn t possibly  Sean Connery - just keeps getting sexier - in fact
messages.messageBody:
Kevin Kline - in any movie even French Kiss where he looks as though he smells but couldn't possibly <g>

Sean Connery - just keeps getting sexier - in fact (well, my fact anyway LOL) is way more doable now than he ever was when he was younger (James Bond movies). Just watched Last Crusade and wished that I'd been home alone to watch it (some things are difficult to explain to the children as in "why are you all red in the face and panting a lot mum, should we call an ambulance??")

Keanu Reeves - totally yum but not sexy like Sean Connery - just yum.

Once upon a time it was Harrison Ford (loved all the cat and mouse scenes with him and carrie fisher in starwars *sigh*), but now he's not aging too well and seems to be having a difficult time finding an 'older' look that isn't ick.

Lee-Ann in Harrow, Victoria, Australia, The World

messages.subject: Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: ... Pirates movie ... Yep!  I can t wait.  He looks especially delicious in that one. ... I have wrestled with that thought.  I saw a movie of his with
messages.messageBody:
> Now Johnny Depp in character, yes for sure. Isn't he doing the
Pirates movie
> coming out??

Yep! I can't wait. He looks especially delicious in that one.

>Very handsome in that garb. But in real life......he looks like
> he smells!

I have wrestled with that thought. I saw a movie of his with
Christina Ricci the other night and he was a gypsy in it, and did
look kinda greasy, and if he really did smell, that would not be
good. But I just tell myself it is a look and he has better sense
(scents ;)than to stink. But then I also tell myself that if I ever
had the chance, and he did stink, I could just shove cotton up my
nostrils or use a clothes pin. But I would keep my eyes WIDE OPEN!
Hee hee hee.

Tory

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: being doable
messages.msgSnippet: ****Pierce Bronsan---VERY do-able ;)**** Hehe, I m thinking ewwwwwww!  Pierce Brosnan reminds me of one of those icky guys with a button  up shirt half undone
messages.messageBody:
****Pierce Bronsan---VERY do-able ;)****

Hehe, I'm thinking ewwwwwww! Pierce Brosnan reminds me of one of those icky
guys with a button up shirt half undone with a gob of chest hair oozing out
and greaser hair and gobs of big chunky gold rings and a thick gold
necklace. I don't know why but he's creepy to me. LOL

Isn't it funny how we percieve other people??? I mean really, I've never
actually *seen* him all decked out like that but that's what I imagine.
Sitting around a pool drinking a martini, spilling it in his chest
hair...ROFLMAO!!!! Oh! I crack myself up!

Jennifer

I agree with the Travolta not-do-able statement. I love him as an actor and
Urban Cowboy is one of my all time favorites no matter how cheesy, but he is
not do-able for me either. I'd like him for a brother though. Then I'd have
access to a plane to get me to the conference!!! Maybe in my next life. Wait I
forgot, I'm not coming back.

Rhonda

I really like Sean Connery. I think he's a good actor, I like him from what
I've seen on interviews and I think he's attractive. But he's not doable for

across as the nicest guy, with his wife, children and family and friends.
But not doable. I'd like him as a neighbor though.

Mary B

Lol,

My hubby is 39 and I am 33 next month so I guess he is older. I dont think I
would do any one shriveled up but I have had not one relationship in my life
that wasn't someone older than me. I actually my DH is the youngest. When I
was younger I was never into the whole party scene. It was hard to see someone
and deal with that. Blaaa

Laura D
